intro: Cycnium veronicifolium subsp. suffruticosum, commonly known as the hairy false nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in loose inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, woodland habitats and is often found in shaded areas with rich, organic soil.
